# MAINTENANCE JOB CARD (MJC) - DIGITAL FORM WIREFRAME

## Document Overview
**Purpose:** Capture all maintenance requests during production with full traceability and hygiene clearance  
**Form Reference:** Based on Form no. 4.7F2 (Revision 4) - BRCGS Product Safety and Quality Management System  
**Digital Implementation:** Integrated with OHiSee Operations Intelligence Centre  
**Auto-Generated Fields:** Date, Time, Job Card No., Raised By, Department (from active session)

---

---

## FIELD SPECIFICATIONS

### Auto-Generated Fields (System-Populated)
| Field | Source | Editable | Notes |
|-------|--------|----------|-------|
| Date | System timestamp | No | Captured at "Create Maintenance Job Card" button press |
| Time | System timestamp | No | Precise time of job card creation |
| Job Card No. | Sequential generator | No | Format: MJC-YYYY-######## |
| Raised By - Name | User session/login | No | Operator currently logged in |
| Department | User profile/work order | No | Department from active production session |
| Kangopak WO Number | Active production session | No | Linked to current work order |
| Work Order Status | Production system | No | Real-time status display |
| Machine/Equipment Description | Active work order | Yes | Can be edited if not auto-populated correctly |

### Required Fields (Cannot Submit Without - Operator Section)
- Machine / Equipment / Plant Description
- Maintenance Category (Reactive or Planned)
- Maintenance Type (Electrical, Mechanical, Pneumatical, Other)
- Machine Status (Down or Operational)
- Urgency Level
- Temporary Repair (Yes or No)
- Description of Maintenance Required (min 100 chars)

### Required Fields (Cannot Close Without - Maintenance Section)
- Maintenance Performed (must be completed)
- Maintenance Technician Name
- Maintenance Technician Signature & Timestamp
- ALL Post Hygiene Clearance checkboxes verified
- Post Hygiene Clearance Name
- Post Hygiene Clearance Signature & Timestamp

### Conditional Required Fields
- If Temporary Repair = YES: Close out due date auto-calculated (Current Date + 14 days)
- If Temporary Repair = YES: System must generate reminder for permanent fix
- If Machine Down = YES: Estimated downtime required
- If Machine Down = YES: Automatic priority alert sent

### Validation Rules
1. Cannot submit initial job card until all operator *REQUIRED fields completed
2. Cannot close job card until Maintenance Performed section completed
3. Cannot close job card until ALL Post Hygiene Clearance items verified
4. Machine Status must be explicitly selected (no default)
5. If Machine Down selected, automatic priority alert sent to maintenance manager
6. Post Hygiene Clearance signature can only be completed by authorized QA/Supervisor role
7. Temporary repairs automatically schedule 14-day follow-up notification

### Workflow States
1. **Draft** - Job card created but not submitted
2. **Open** - Submitted to Maintenance Register, awaiting assignment
3. **Assigned** - Assigned to maintenance technician
4. **In Progress** - Maintenance work underway
5. **Awaiting Clearance** - Work completed, pending hygiene clearance
6. **Closed** - Hygiene clearance signed, production can resume

---

## INTEGRATION REQUIREMENTS

### Work Order Linkage
- MJC automatically linked to active work order at time of creation
- Bidirectional relationship maintained in database
- Work order status shows "Maintenance in Progress" when MJC is open
- Work order closure validation: checks for open maintenance job cards

### Navigation Flow
1. Operator in waste metrics screen â†’ Clicks "Create Maintenance Job Card"
2. System captures active work order context
3. Redirects to MJC form with auto-populated fields
4. Upon submission â†’ Entry added to Maintenance Job Card Register
5. Notification sent to maintenance team
6. Maintenance technician receives alert and accesses job card
7. After work completion and hygiene clearance â†’ Production notified to resume

### Register Update
- Automatic entry creation in Maintenance Job Card Register upon submission
- Real-time status updates throughout workflow states
- Management dashboard shows pending maintenance requests requiring attention
- Maintenance team dashboard shows assigned jobs by technician

### Notification Triggers
- **On Submission:**
  - Machine Down status â†’ Immediate SMS/email to Maintenance Manager
  - Critical urgency â†’ Alert to Maintenance Manager and relevant technician
  - High urgency â†’ Email to Maintenance team
  
- **On Assignment:**
  - Email to assigned maintenance technician with job card details
  
- **On Completion:**
  - Notification to QA/Supervisor for hygiene clearance
  
- **On Hygiene Clearance:**
  - Production notification that machine cleared for use
  - Email to operator who raised the job card
  
- **Temporary Repair Follow-up:**
  - 10 days after temporary repair: reminder email to maintenance manager
  - 13 days after temporary repair: escalation alert if permanent fix not scheduled
  - 14 days after temporary repair: mandatory compliance notification

### Daily Summary Integration
- All MJCs created during shift included in end-of-day submission
- Real-time list of open maintenance requests
- Summary includes status of each job card (Open, In Progress, Completed, Cleared)

---

## POST HYGIENE CLEARANCE CHECKLIST DETAILS

### Critical Food Safety Verification
The Post Hygiene Clearance section is **mandatory for BRCGS compliance** and ensures no contamination risk before production resumes.

**Verification Process:**
1. All 10 checklist items must be individually verified (âœ… or âŒ)
2. Cannot have any âŒ items and still grant clearance
3. If any item fails verification, must document corrective action in Comments
4. Re-verification required after corrective action
5. Only authorized QA/Supervisor can complete this section

**Checklist Items Explained:**
| Item | Purpose | Verification Method |
|------|---------|---------------------|
| Excess Grease & Oil Removed | Prevent lubricant contamination | Visual inspection of work area |
| Consumables Removed | Prevent foreign body contamination | Check for rags, tape, packaging |
| Tools & Equipment Removed | Prevent foreign body contamination | Tool count verification |
| Safety Mechanisms Working | Operator safety and machine function | Test guards, interlocks, e-stops |
| Product Safety Equipment Reinstated | Foreign body prevention | Check swarf mats, filters, screens |
| Area Cleared of Debris | Prevent contamination | Visual inspection for metal swarf, wood |
| No Contamination Risk | Overall safety assessment | Comprehensive area inspection |
| Potential Foreign Bodies Check | Proactive contamination prevention | Check for loose parts, fasteners |
| Production Surfaces Inspected | Ensure contact surfaces are clean | Inspect sealer bars, rollers, conveyor |
| Area Ready for Production | Final authorization | Complete area assessment |

---

## MOBILE RESPONSIVENESS
- Form must be fully functional on tablets (shop floor use)
- Touch-friendly input controls (minimum 44px tap targets)
- Portrait and landscape orientation support
- Offline data capture with sync capability when connectivity restored
- Photo attachment capability using device camera
- Large text areas with zoom capability
- Signature pad optimized for touch/stylus input

---

## BRCGS COMPLIANCE NOTES
This digital form must maintain all traceability and documentation requirements per BRCGS Issue 7:
- Complete audit trail of all entries and modifications
- Timestamp and user tracking for all actions
- Export capability for external audit documentation
- Historical data retention (minimum 3 years)
- Tamper-evident logging of changes
- Hygiene clearance sign-off mandatory before production resumption
- Integration with preventive maintenance scheduling system
- Tracking of temporary repairs with mandatory follow-up

---

## INTEGRATION WITH PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE SYSTEM

### Planned Maintenance Tracking
- If Maintenance Category = "Planned Maintenance", link to preventive maintenance schedule
- Auto-populate expected work from maintenance plan
- Track completion against scheduled maintenance calendar
- Update next scheduled maintenance date after completion

### Temporary Repair Management
- System generates automatic reminder at Day 10 after temporary repair
- Escalation to maintenance manager at Day 13
- Mandatory notification at Day 14 with compliance flag
- Ability to create follow-up permanent job card directly from temporary repair card
- Dashboard widget showing all active temporary repairs approaching 14-day limit

### Spare Parts Integration (Future Enhancement)
- Link to spare parts inventory system
- Record parts used during maintenance
- Auto-generate parts requisition
- Update spare parts stock levels

---

## REPORTING & ANALYTICS

### Maintenance Metrics
- Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) by machine
- Mean Time To Repair (MTTR) by issue type
- Maintenance response time by urgency level
- Planned vs. reactive maintenance ratio
- Temporary repair conversion rate to permanent fix
- Most common failure modes by machine

### Compliance Reporting
- Hygiene clearance completion rate
- Time from maintenance completion to hygiene clearance
- Temporary repair closure compliance (within 14 days)
- Outstanding maintenance job cards aging report

---

## PERMISSION LEVELS

| Role | Can Create | Can Edit | Can Assign | Can Complete Maintenance | Can Grant Hygiene Clearance | Can Close |
|------|-----------|----------|------------|-------------------------|----------------------------|-----------|
| Operator | Yes | Own Draft Only | No | No | No | No |
| Team Leader | Yes | Any Draft | No | No | No | No |
| Maintenance Technician | Yes | Any Open/In Progress | No | Yes | No | No |
| QA/Supervisor | Yes | Any | Yes | No | Yes | Yes |
| Maintenance Manager | Yes | Any | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Operations Manager | View Only | No | No | No | No | View Only |
